key.name: windows-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from application windows, dialogs, and window decorations.

key.name: panel-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from the top panel and its buttons.

key.name: buttons-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from buttons throughout the GNOME Shell.

key.name: dialogs-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from modal dialogs and prompts.

key.name: overview-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from overview elements like search bar and app icons.

key.name: notifications-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from notifications and banners.

key.name: menus-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from popup menus, context menus, and quick settings.

key.name: osd-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from on-screen displays (volume, brightness, etc.).

key.name: dash-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from the dash (dock) and its app icons.

key.name: calendar-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from the calendar and date menu elements.

key.name: lock-screen-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from lock screen and login dialog elements.

key.name: tooltips-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from tooltips and labels.

key.name: entries-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from text entries and input fields.

key.name: switches-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from toggle switches and sliders.

key.name: gtk4-apps-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from GTK4 applications like Settings, Files, Extensions, etc. This modifies ~/.config/gtk-4.0/gtk.css and requires applications to be restarted to take effect.

key.name: gtk3-apps-enabled
key.description: Remove rounded corners from GTK3 applications like Firefox, etc. This modifies ~/.config/gtk-3.0/gtk.css and requires applications to be restarted to take effect.
